results.title: Parental Self-Esteem
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
It is important for both adults and children that parents maintain their self esteem. PGR examines various aspects of self esteem, including comparisons between reality and media images of parenthood, personal accounts of low self esteem - two mothers describe how they coped with it and survived, and dealing with the effects of unremitting child company. We also look at how and where parents can seek relief should any problems occur.

results.title: Child Care
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
This title is introduced by a discussion on babysitting, including co-operatives. We follow this with an introduction to Childcare centres, visiting two centres and talking with both a provider and a user of Family Day Care about this domestic alternative. A third, bi-lingual, Childcare centre is visited, and we describe Childcare Co-operatives. Two parents, a mother and a father, discuss their decisions to care for children full-time at home and we suggest guidelines for choosing and using Childcare facilities.

results.title: The Working parent
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Combining work with parenthood provides numerous pressures for working parents. P.G.R. looks at some of these problems, including house duties, mother’s re-entry to the workforce, workplace issues affecting women’s rights, managing chores while caring for children, and becoming a house husband. We talk to a number of people from a variety of backgrounds who have managed to balance the competing needs of their careers and their children.

results.title: The Single Parent
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
P.G.R. starts this topic by talking with a group of people about how they became single parents, and how they coped during the early stages. We then examine the problems of being a single parent, including household and financial management, helping children through this difficult period of their lives, and sharing the responsibility for the care of the kids. Finally, our guests reflect on their experiences, discussing the hardships and what they have gained as single parents.

results.title: Change
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Children can be disoriented by change, and here we discuss this process. Parents describe the effects on their children of moving house, changing childcare centres, and emergency admissions into hospital. We discuss behaviour patterns which may indicate change is disturbing to a child. Two families talk about the deaths, one expected, the other sudden, of younger children. Finally we discuss ways of dealing with change.
